âœ¨ retrogram-plutosdr | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Real-time spectrum analysis and visualization on a terminal or SSH console using ASCII art, primarily intended for use with the ADALM PLUTO SDR.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Wideband spectrum analysis â€¢ Terminal/SSH console display â€¢ ASCII art visualization â€¢ Keyboard controls for pan, zoom, and parameter adjustment
ðŸ“– Summary: The retrogram-plutosdr repository provides a wideband spectrum analyzer that runs directly in a terminal or SSH console. It uses ASCII art to visualize the spectrum, allowing users to monitor radio frequencies without a graphical interface. The application supports keyboard controls for adjusting parameters like frequency, bandwidth, and gain, making it suitable for remote or resource-constrained environments.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ purrcrypt | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Encrypting files and messages with a layer of security and a playful disguise.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Encrypts data using elliptic curve cryptography â€¢ Encodes encrypted data as cat and dog sounds â€¢ Provides a command-line interface for key generation, encryption, and decryption â€¢ Supports setting a cat or dog 'dialect' for the output â€¢ Offers a playful and fun approach to cryptography
ðŸ“– Summary: PurrCrypt is an encryption tool that uses elliptic curve cryptography to secure data. It uniquely encodes the encrypted data as cat and dog sounds, providing a playful and less conspicuous way to transmit sensitive information. The tool offers a command-line interface for key management, encryption, and decryption, making cryptography more approachable and fun.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ jira-cli | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a feature-rich command-line interface for interacting with Atlassian Jira, improving day-to-day workflow by avoiding the Jira UI for common tasks.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Interactive command-line interface â€¢ Issue search and navigation â€¢ Issue creation â€¢ Issue cloning â€¢ Issue linking
ðŸ“– Summary: JiraCLI is a command-line tool for interacting with Atlassian Jira. It provides features such as issue searching, creation, cloning, linking, and ticket transitioning, all accessible through an interactive terminal interface. The tool aims to improve developer workflow by offering a faster alternative to the Jira UI for common tasks.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ ots | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Securely sharing sensitive information one time only.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AES 256bit encryption â€¢ Server never gets the password â€¢ Secret is deleted on first read
ðŸ“– Summary: OTS is a one-time-secret sharing platform that uses AES 256-bit encryption in the browser to protect secrets. The server never receives the password, and the secret is deleted after the first read, ensuring maximum security for sensitive information.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ pyper | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: ETL Systems, Data Microservices, and Data Collection
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intuitive API for concurrent and parallel data-processing â€¢ Functional programming paradigm â€¢ Safety: Hides task execution and resource clean-up complexities â€¢ Efficiency: Lazy execution using queues, workers, and generators â€¢ Pure Python: Lightweight with zero sub-dependencies
ðŸ“– Summary: Pyper is a Python framework designed to simplify concurrent and parallel data processing using functional programming patterns. It provides an intuitive API for building data pipelines, abstracting away the complexities of threading, multiprocessing, and asynchronous execution. Pyper is suitable for ETL systems, data microservices, and data collection applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ arq | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Asynchronous task processing and job queuing using Redis as a message broker.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Job queuing â€¢ RPC (Remote Procedure Call) â€¢ Asynchronous task processing â€¢ Redis integration
ðŸ“– Summary: Arq is a Python library for fast job queuing and RPC using asyncio and Redis. It enables developers to offload tasks to background workers for asynchronous processing, improving application responsiveness and scalability. Arq leverages Redis for message brokering and asyncio for concurrent execution.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ roop | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Replacing faces in videos with a desired face using a single image, without requiring datasets or training.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ One-click face swap â€¢ Requires only one image of the desired face â€¢ No dataset or training required â€¢ Headless mode support â€¢ Various frame processors (face_swapper, face_enhancer, etc.)
ðŸ“– Summary: Roop is a one-click face-swapping tool that allows users to replace faces in videos with a desired face using only a single image. It offers various customization options, including frame processors, video encoding settings, and memory management. The tool supports headless mode and provides options for processing multiple faces and fine-tuning the face-swapping process.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ BruteX | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated brute-forcing of services running on a target system to identify vulnerabilities.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Open port discovery â€¢ Username brute-forcing â€¢ Password brute-forcing â€¢ Docker support
ðŸ“– Summary: BruteX is a shell script designed to automatically brute-force various services running on a target. It focuses on identifying open ports and then attempting to crack usernames and passwords. The tool can be installed via a shell script or run within a Docker container.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ sagemode | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Digital Investigations
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Easy to Use â€¢ Real-time Feedback â€¢ Curated List of sites
ðŸ“– Summary: Sagemode is an OSINT username search tool designed for simplicity and efficiency. It allows users to search for specific usernames across various online platforms, providing real-time feedback on positive search results. The tool is intended for digital investigations, cybersecurity research, and online reputation management.
